generif.text: Comparative characterization of two DEAD-box RNA helicases in superfamily II: human translation-initiation factor 4A and hepatitis C virus non-structural protein 3 (NS3) helicase.
Results indicate that not only binding to eIF4A but also prevention of eIF4A binding to the MA-3 domain of eIF4Gc contributes to the mechanism by which Pdcd4 inhibits translation.

analysis of cells of eIF4GIf molecules lacking either the PABP-binding site, the eIF3-binding site, the middle domain eIF4A-binding site, or the C-terminal segment that includes the second eIF4A-binding site
Results report that 15d-PGJ2 blocks translation through inactivation of translational initiation factor eIF4A.
the PDCD4 MA3 domains compete with the eIF4G MA3 domain and RNA for eIF4A binding.  PDCD4 inhibits translation initiation by displacing eIF4G and RNA from eIF4A.
The interaction of eIF4AI with two accessory factors, eIF4B and eIF4H, was studied.
Study reports the topology of the eIF4A/4G/4H helicase complex, which is built from multiple experimentally observed domain-domain contacts.
These findings identify PKP1 as a regulator of translation and proliferation via modulation of eIF4A1 activity.
Inhibition of eIF4A reduced the synthesis of APP and tau.
EIF4A and eIF4G proteins are not responsible for the selective translation of viral mRNAs and the translational shut-off of cellular protein synthesis.
Studies indicate that eIF4A (DDX2), together with its accessory proteins eIF4B and eIF4H, is thought to act as a helicase that unwinds secondary structures in the mRNA 5' UTR.
analysis of the tandem MA-3 region of Pdcd4 protein and characterization of its interactions with eIF4A and eIF4G
Duplex unwinding and ATPase activities of the DEAD-box helicase eIF4A are coupled by eIF4G and eIF4B.

study found Burkholderia pseudomallei BPSL1549 acted as a potent cytotoxin against eukaryotic cells; it promotes deamidation of glutamine-339 of the translation initiation factor eIF4A, abolishing its helicase activity and inhibiting translation
The results indicated that eIF4AI and eIF4AII expression are linked and that the two protein isoforms exhibit functional differences.
Regulation of MUC1-C expression is mediated by the PI3K/AKT pathway and the eIF4A RNA helicase.
Eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A1 (eIF4A1) is a direct target of miR-US25-2-3p.
Findings implicate phosphorylation of eIF4G1(Ser1232) by Cdk1:cyclin B and its inhibitory effects on eIF4A helicase activity in the mitotic translation initiation shift.

The E186 residue was found to be of significance for RNA-dependent ATPase activity for eIF4AI alone and in the presence of eIF4AI-binding domains of eIF4GI, binding between eIF4AI and eIF4GI domains were also significantly influenced by mutation of E186.
Increased Expression of EIF4A1 is associated with poor response to Brachytherapy in Cervical Cancer.
Studies indicate that eukaryotic initiation factor 4AI (EIF4AI) undergoes large conformational transitions, while unwinding RNA hairpins.
report of an eIF4A RNA helicase-dependent mechanism of translational control that contributes to oncogenesis and underlies the anticancer effects of silvestrol and related compounds
Data indicate that caspase recruitment domain family, member 11 protein CARD11 has complex 5'UTRs and is sensitive to eIF4A RNA helicase inhibition.

Immunohistochemical analysis was performed on over 3000 breast tumors to investigate the relationship among expression of eIF4A1, the helicase-modulating proteins eIF4B, eIF4E and PDCD4, and clinical outcome.
demonstrate that DAP5 associates with eIF2beta and eIF4AI to stimulate IRES-dependent translation of cellular mRNAs
Collectively, these data suggested that a potential role of NS4A in antagonizing host antiviral defense is by recruiting eIF4AI and escaping the translation inhibition mediated by PKR.
eIF4A functions as an adenosine triphosphate-dependent processive helicase when complexed with two accessory proteins, eIF4G and eIF4B.
Studies indicate a developing focus on targeting eukaryotic initiation factor 4A eIF4A1 and eIF4A2 as cancer therapy.
miR-1284 can function as a new regulator to reduce gastric cancer multidrug resistant cells by targeting EIF4A1.
our data identify the eIF4F complex as an important upstream regulator of TORC1, which acts via TSC2 to inactivate TORC1 upon withdrawal of amino acids
our data demonstrate that the common effects of eIF4A1 and eIF4E on translation are mediated by the coding region and 3'UTR

Our results demonstrate that miR-133a plays a pivotal role in colorectal cancer by inhibiting cell proliferation, invasion, and migration by targeting oncogenic eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A1, which acts as a tumor suppressor and may provide a new potential therapeutic target in colorectal cancer
Star-PAP-specific polyadenylation sites usage regulates the expression of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor EIF4A1, the tumor suppressor gene PTEN and the long non-coding RNA NEAT1.

Results indicate that ubiquitin specific peptidase 9, X-linked (USP9X) is a regulator of the translation initiation process via deubiquitination of eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A1 (eIF4A1), which is a substrate of USP9X in vivo.
Elatol's identification as an eIF4A1 inhibitor with in vivo antitumor activities provides proof of principle for target-based screening against this highly promising target for cancer therapy.

Results suggest that rev protein, HIV-1 (Rev) regulates the association of nuclear cap-binding protein NCBP 80 kDa subunit (CBP80) and eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A1 (eIF4AI) with the unspliced mRNA in the cytoplasm and the nucleus, respectively, during HIV-1 replication.
RocA targets the "bi-molecular cavity" formed characteristically by eIF4A1 and a sharply bent pair of consecutive purines in the RNA to inhibit genetic translation.
Besides catalyzing serine synthesis, PHGDH promotes pancreatic cancer development through enhancing the translation initiations by interacting with eIF4A1 and eIF4E.
This work demonstrates the importance of eIF4A in translational control of pancreatic tumour metabolism.
remodels local 5' untranslated region structures

a number of new small molecules have been reported as having the capacity to target and inhibit eIF4A. Here, we undertook a comparative analysis of their biological activity and specificity relative to the eIF4A inhibitor, hippuristanol.
High intratumoral expression of eIF4A1 promotes epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and predicts unfavorable prognosis in gastric cancer.
The mRNA helicase eIF4A1 is involved in unwinding the G4 in the 5'-UTR of CtlP mRNA through its cooperation with ALC1.
Identification and characterization of hippuristanol-resistant mutants reveals eIF4A1 dependencies within mRNA 5' leader regions.
Targeting eIF4A-Dependent Translation of KRAS Signaling Molecules.
Epigenetic regulation of EIF4A1 through DNA methylation and an oncogenic role of eIF4A1 through BRD2 signaling in prostate cancer.
eIF4A/PDCD4 Pathway, a Factor for Doxorubicin Chemoresistance in a Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Cell Model.
eIF4A1-dependent mRNAs employ purine-rich 5'UTR sequences to activate localised eIF4A1-unwinding through eIF4A1-multimerisation to facilitate translation.
eIF4A1 Is a Prognostic Marker and Actionable Target in Human Hepatocellular Carcinoma.
mTORC1/S6K1 signaling promotes sustained oncogenic translation through modulating CRL3[IBTK]-mediated ubiquitination of eIF4A1 in cancer cells.

summary: Enables double-stranded RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translational initiation. Located in cytoplasm. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
